statement.p: Explain how to find the absolute minimum and absolute maximum values of the function f(x)={{fx}} on the interval [{{a}},{{b}}].

answer.p: The absolute extrema may occur at these x-values: {{a}}, {{z}}, {{b}}.
Thus the absolute minimum is {{min}} and the absolute maximum is {{max}}.
(The value f({{ignored}})={{fignored}} is ignored as {{ignored}} isn't in the given interval.)
